revision.text:
{{Infobox university | name = Rajiv Gandhi Institute of Petroleum Technology (RGIPT) | image = RGIPTLogo.png | image_size = 180px | president = K.B. Akhilesh{{cite web|url=http://rgipt.ac.in/president_msg.htm |title=Rajiv Gandhi Institute of Petroleum Technology: President's message |publisher=Rgipt.ac.in |date=2007-12-20 |accessdate=2012-12-06}} | director = P.K. Bhattacharya | established = 2007{{cite web|url=http://www.rgipt.ac.in/aboutus.htm|publisher=rgipt.ac.in|title=:: Welcome to Rajiv Gandhi Institute of Petroleum Technology ::|accessdate=2016-11-11}} | mottoeng = "Education is the ultimate wealth" | undergrad = 480 | postgrad = 130 | staff = 40 | endowment = {{INRConvert|17.7|b}} all campuses{{Cite web |url=http://petroleum.nic.in/docs/aco/budget2016.pdf |title=Archived copy |access-date=21 October 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161021132348/http://petroleum.nic.in/docs/aco/budget2016.pdf |archive-date=21 October 2016 |dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all }}{{cite web|url=http://www.projectsmonitor.com/detailnews.asp?newsid%3D12527 |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2012-12-06 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110928124204/http://www.projectsmonitor.com/detailnews.asp?newsid=12527 |archivedate=28 September 2011 |df= }}http://www.rgipt.ac.in/pdf/Annual-Report_100118.pdf | coor = {{coord|26.2648064|81.5054372|display=inline,title}} | type = [[Institute of National Importance]], [[Public university|Public]] | city = [[Jais, Amethi]] | state = [[Uttar Pradesh]] | country = [[India]] | colors = | free = RGIPT | campus = Rural, {{convert|125|acre|m2}}{{cite web|url=http://www.rgipt.ac.in/main_campus_project.htm|publisher=rgipt.ac.in|title=:: Welcome to Rajiv Gandhi Institute of Petroleum Technology ::|accessdate=2016-11-11}} | website = {{URL|http://www.rgipt.ac.in/}} }} '''Rajiv Gandhi Institute of Petroleum Technology''' ('''RGIPT'''), in [[Jais, Amethi]], [[Uttar Pradesh]], [[India]], is a training and education institute that gives technical and management training to the [[petroleum industry]] and was formally opened on July 2008. The [[Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Gas]] (MOP&NG), Government of India founded the institute through an Act of Parliament (“Rajiv Gandhi Institute of Petroleum Technology Act 2007").{{cite web|url=http://www.topnews.in/sonia-lay-foundation-rajiv-gandhi-petroleum-institute-rae-bareli-221339|publisher=topnews.in|title=Sonia to lay foundation for Rajiv Gandhi Petroleum Institute in Rae Bareli | TopNews|accessdate=2016-11-11}} The Institute is empowered to award degrees in its own right. RGIPT is co-promoted as an energy domain specific institute by six leading Oil Public Sector Units (ONGC, IOCL, OIL, GAIL, BPCL and HPCL) in association with the Oil Industry Development Board (OIDB) and with an academic mentorship from [[IIT Kanpur]].{{cite web|url=http://www.dnaindia.com/india/report-union-minister-dharmendra-pradhan-asks-rahul-gandhi-to-first-make-robert-vadra-wear-kurta-pajama-2116160|publisher=dnaindia.com|title=Union Minister Dharmendra Pradhan asks Rahul Gandhi to first make Robert Vadra 'wear kurta pajama' | Latest News & Updates at Daily News & Analysis|accessdate=2016-11-11}} The Institute is associating with leading International Universities/Institutions specializing in the domain of Petroleum Technology.{{cite web|url=http://www.rgipt.ac.in/aboutus.htm|publisher=rgipt.ac.in|title=:: Welcome to Rajiv Gandhi Institute of Petroleum Technology ::|accessdate=2016-11-11}} It has been accorded the [[Institute of National Importance]] status and a governance structure similar to that available to IITs.{{cite web|url=http://articles.economictimes.indiatimes.com/2008-02-20/news/27693991_1_foundation-stone-petroleum-sector-sonia-gandhi|publisher=articles.economictimes.indiatimes.com|title=Sonia Gandhi lays foundation stone of petroleum institute – The Economic Times|accessdate=2016-11-11}} It admits undergraduate students from the rank list of students who have qualified [[Joint Entrance Examination – Advanced]] (JEE Advanced) Examination.{{cite web|url=http://indiatoday.intoday.in/education/story/jee-advanced-2014-list-of-participating-institutions/1/367622.html|publisher=indiatoday.intoday.in|title=JEE Advanced 2014: List of participating institutions : Notification|accessdate=2016-11-11}} ==RGIPT Campuses== ===Jais, Amethi Campus=== *Started academic sessions in June 2008 at a temporary campus at [[Rae Bareli]]. On 15 October 2016, the institute moved from temporary campus to the permanent campus at [[Jais]].{{cite web|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/Pradhan-takes-jibe-at-Rahul-over-kurta-pajama-remark/articleshow/48549793.cms|publisher=timesofindia.indiatimes.com|title=Pradhan takes jibe at Rahul over kurta-pajama remark – Times of India|accessdate=2016-11-11}} * This campus offers the B.Tech, M.Tech, PhD programs and other research related activities. The cost for setting up this campus was {{INRConvert|8.61|b}}.https://web.archive.org/web/20110928124204/http://www.projectsmonitor.com/detailnews.asp?newsid=12527 ===Noida Campus=== * This campus used to run MBA and related courses. On 15 October 2016, the institute moved from temporary campus to the permanent campus at Jais. ===Assam Campus=== * Started academic sessions in 2017 at [[Sivasagar]], [[Assam]] in 37 acres as a first phase while 63 acres is under construction.http://www.newindianexpress.com/cities/bengaluru/2017/jun/14/soon-karnataka-to-get-petroleum-research-institute-1616468.html In consonance with the charter of RGIPT, the objective of this campus is offering of programmes of education and training of skilled technical manpower at the certificate, diploma and post diploma level in various areas in the domain of petroleum, petrochemical and allied sector, training & certificate programmes (refresher and induction) for working professionals of oil and gas, petrochemical and allied companies, to serve as a Skill Development Center for the North-East Region and to offer B. Tech. in Fire Safety Engineering domain of the petroleum sector as per requirements of the oil, gas and [[petrochemical industry]].{{cite web|url=http://www.thehindu.com/news/national/article1471990.ece|publisher=thehindu.com|title=Centre committed to development of Assam, northeast: Manmohan – The Hindu|accessdate=2016-11-11}} * On May 13, 2017, [[Chief Minister]] of [[Assam]] [[Sarbananda Sonowal]] and [[Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Gas|Minister of Petroleum and Natural Gas]] [[Dharmendra Pradhan|Shri Dharmendra Pradhan]] jointly launched the full swing construction work of second campus at [[Sivasagar district|Sivasagar]], [[Assam]].http://news.webindia123.com/news/Articles/India/20170513/3107431.html This campus is being built at a cost of {{INRConvert|8.801|b}}.http://www.rgipt.ac.in/pdf/Annual-Report_100118.pdf ===Bangalore Campus=== * Third campus of RGIPT, “Energy Institute, Bangalore” is in [[Bengaluru]] – which is envisioned to be a distinguished energy research institute offering world class research, and education, so as to be ranked in the top 20 institutes of the world in next 20 years.http://www.rgipt.ac.in/rgipt_center-Banglore.htm * In July 2013, [[Karnataka]] government agreed to offer 150 acres of land to set up the [[Bangalore]] centre which is going to be the Asia's first centre on fire and safety for oil and gas sector.{{cite web|url=http://www.business-standard.com/article/current-affairs/rgipt-to-set-up-rs-355-crore-research-centre-in-bangalore-113072000705_1.html|publisher=business-standard.com|title=RGIPT to set up Rs 355 crore research centre in Bangalore | Business Standard News|accessdate=2016-11-11}} The institute will start functioning from 2018–19 academic year. * The purpose of the Energy Institute is to drive economic growth through Energy R&D, Technology development, Energy innovation and entrepreneurship. The INSTITUTE would conduct cutting-edge industrial, technological, and basic research; Offer education to students; and Training to industry professionals in the field of energy. The institute is also aiming to create Energy Experience Centre, Incubation Cell / E-Cell, Office of licensing and commercialization to facilitate immersive experience of energy technologies.http://www.rgipt.ac.in/rgipt_center-Banglore.htm * This campus would initially house 10 research labs established over 1.8 lakh square feet in a research cum academic complex. An Energy Experience Centre, Incubation/E-Cell, Library, Auditorium and Seminar Halls etc will support the activities of the campus. The institute coming up will cost {{INRConvert|18|b}}.http://www.newindianexpress.com/cities/bengaluru/2017/jun/14/soon-karnataka-to-get-petroleum-research-institute-1616468.htmlhttp://www.rgipt.ac.in/pdf/Annual-Report_100118.pdf * For setting up of the Institute, a land of 150 acres has been allotted to RGIPT by Government of Karnataka in Kambalipura, Hosakote Taluk. While construction of this Centre of Excellence in Kambalipura land would require a few years, academic sessions would begin from the year 2018-19 from a temporary campus of Visvewaraya Technological University Campus, Muddenahalli ([[Chikkaballapur|Chikkaballapur District]]). To start with three M Tech Programmes are designed in the fields of Renewable Energy, Power and Energy Systems Engineering and Energy Science and Technology that would commence from September 2018.http://www.rgipt.ac.in/rgipt_center-Banglore.htm ==Admissions== * The institute admits B.Tech students from the rank list of qualified students in the prestigious [[Joint Entrance Examination – Advanced|JEE Advanced Examination]] and M.Tech through [[Graduate Aptitude Test in Engineering|GATE]].{{cite web|url=http://rgipt.ac.in/btech_addmission.htm |title=Rajiv Gandhi Institute of Petroleum Technology: Admissions |publisher=Rgipt.ac.in |date= |accessdate=2012-12-06}} * For [[MBA]], institute admits candidates from qualification through [[Common Admission Test|CAT]] score.{{cite web|url=http://www.rgipt.ac.in/mba_addmission.htm |title=Rajiv Gandhi Institute of Petroleum Technology: MBA admissions |publisher=Rgipt.ac.in |date= |accessdate=2012-12-06}} * For admission to PhD programmes, candidates must have a valid scorecard of: GRE/NET (UGC/CSIR)/NBHM/ DBT/ GPAT/ Rajiv Gandhi National Fellowship/ Maulana Azad National Fellowship/ DST Inspire Award or any similar Fellowship.[http://www.rgipt.ac.in/PhD.html "Admission in Phd"] ==Opening and closing ranks in each category== [[File:RGIPT Central library.jpg|300px|thumb|right|Central Library]] Opening and closing ranks for each category in [[Joint Entrance Examination|JEE Advanced]] 2016:{{cite web|url=http://rgipt.ac.in/btech_admission.htm|publisher=rgipt.ac.in|title=:: Welcome to Rajiv Gandhi Institute of Petroleum Technology ::|accessdate=2016-11-11}} {| class="wikitable" |Course |'''CRL''' |'''OB''' |'''SC''' |'''ST''' |- |'''Opening ranks''' | | | | |- |'''CH''' |4368 |3251 |293 |125 |- |'''PE''' |931 |3678 |479 |81 |- |'''Closing ranks''' | | | | |- |'''CH''' |11488 |4101 |1395 |270 |- |'''PE''' |11278 |3940 |2041 |175 |- |} ==Academic programmes== {{EngvarB|date=May 2014}} {{Use dmy dates|date=May 2014}} {{location map+|India|float=right|width=320|caption=Location of the RGIPTs. Green – Operational, Red – Under Construction{{cite web|url=http://www.rgipt.ac.in/rgipt_center.htm|publisher=rgipt.ac.in|title=:: Welcome to Rajiv Gandhi Institute of Petroleum Technology ::|accessdate=2016-11-11}}|places= {{Location map~|India|label='''Jais'''
(Amethi)|mark=Green_pog.svg|position=bottom|lat=26.1541|long=81.8142}} {{Location map~|India|label='''Sivsagar'''
(Sivsagar)|mark=Green_pog.svg|position=bottom|lat=26.9844|long=94.6314}} {{Location map~|India|label='''Bangalore'''
(Bangalore)|mark=Red_pog.svg|position=bottom|lat=12.9667|long=77.5667}} {{Location map~|India|label='''Noida'''
(DoMS, Noida)|mark=Green_pog.svg|position=left|lat=28.5700|long=77.3200}} }} * RGIPT offers courses in engineering, pure sciences, management and humanities with a focus on petroleum engineering. The programs and courses offered at RGIPT are changing as the school evolving into a full-fledged petroleum engineering university. * Admission to the courses of B.Tech is done from candidates appearing for JEE Advanced Examination. Admission to the M.Tech courses are done either through the Graduate Aptitude Test in Engineering (GATE). Admissions to the MBA program is done through the Common Admission Test (CAT). * Admission to the M.Sc.Tech. and PhD courses are done through examinations conducted by the institute. {| class="wikitable" |- | style="width:25%;"| '''Degree''' || '''Specialization''' |- | style="width:25%;"| Bachelor of Technology (B.Tech) || Chemical Engineering, Petroleum Engineering.http://rgipt.ac.in/btech_1.html{{dead link|date=April 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} |- | style="width:25%;"| Master of Technology (M.Tech) || Chemical Engineering, Petroleum Engineering.{{cite web|url=http://rgipt.ac.in/mtech_1.html|publisher=rgipt.ac.in|title=:: Welcome to Rajiv Gandhi Institute of Petroleum Technology ::|accessdate=2016-11-11}} |- | style="width:25%;"| Master of Business Administration || MBA in Finance,Marketing,HR,Operation Management,Energy Management.{{cite web|url=http://domsrgipt.ac.in/|publisher=domsrgipt.ac.in|title=DoMS, Rajiv Gandhi Institute of Petroleum Technology – Department of Management Studies, Rajiv Gandhi Institute of Petroleum Technology|accessdate=2016-11-11}} |- | style="width:25%;"| B.Sc-M.Sc Integrated Course || Chemical and Petroleum. (To be started in [[Sivasagar]] campus){{cite web|url=http://rgipt.ac.in/rgipt_center.htm|publisher=rgipt.ac.in|title=:: Welcome to Rajiv Gandhi Institute of Petroleum Technology ::|accessdate=2016-11-11}} |- | style="width:25%;"| Diploma Course || Chemical and Petroleum. (Started in [[Sivasagar]] campus in 2017)http://www.newindianexpress.com/cities/bengaluru/2017/jun/14/soon-karnataka-to-get-petroleum-research-institute-1616468.html |- | style="width:25%;"| PhD || All engineering disciplines, interdisciplinary areas, science disciplines and the humanities. |} ==Departments== RGIPT has the following departments:{{cite web|url=http://rgipt.ac.in/academic_departments.htm |title=Rajiv Gandhi Institute of Petroleum Technology: Academic departments |publisher=Rgipt.ac.in |date= |accessdate=2012-12-06}} [[File:Academic Blocks at RGIPT.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Departmental Blocks]] * Department of Petroleum Engineering * Department of Chemical Engineering * Department of Management Studies * Department of Geology * Department of Chemistry * Department of Physics * Department of English * Department of Mathematics ===Future Departments=== * Department of Instrumentation Engineering * Department of Fire Engineering * Department of Mechanical Engineering ==Academic collaboration== [[File:Main Hostel Building.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Main Hostel Building]] RGIPT has academic collaboration with the many universities in India and abroad.{{cite web|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/bangalore/Moily-inaugurates-fire-safety-engineering-and-process-safety-research-centre/articleshow/31477170.cms|publisher=timesofindia.indiatimes.com|title=Moily inaugurates fire safety engineering and process safety research centre – Times of India|accessdate=2016-11-11}} Some of the major universities which have a [[Memorandum of Understanding]] (MOU) and share research projects with RGIPT are as follows:http://www.rgipt.ac.in/pdf/brochure_5march2014.pdf * [[Texas A&M University]], [[United States|USA]] * [[Kun Shan University]], [[Taiwan]] * [[Chonnam National University]], [[South Korea]] * [[Lund University]], [[Sweden]] * [[Cheng Shiu University]], [[Taiwan]] * [[Louisiana State University]], [[United States|USA]] * [[National Yunlin University of Science and Technology]], [[Taiwan]] * [[University of Houston]], [[United States|USA]] * [[Indian Institute of Petroleum]], [[Dehradun]] * [[Faculty of Management Studies (Delhi)|Faculty of Management Studies]], [[New Delhi]] * [[Indian Institute of Technology Kanpur|IIT Kanpur]] * [[IIT Bombay]] ==Integrated Aerospace Development Program== [[File:D Block of RGIPT Hostel.jpg|300px|thumb|right|D-Block of hostel]] RGIPT has collaborated with some pioneer institutes for advancements in [[aviation]]/aerospace and [[Rocket propellant|Rocket Fuels]]/Petroleum Technology.{{cite web|url=http://www.rgipt.ac.in/jai_prakash_gupta.htm|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120930005356/http://www.rgipt.ac.in/jai_prakash_gupta.htm|dead-url=yes|archive-date=2012-09-30|title=:: Welcome to Rajiv Gandhi Institute of Petroleum Technology ::|accessdate=2016-11-11}} * [[Indian Institute of Technology Kanpur]] through an MOU has decided to be the mentor of the program.{{cite web |url=http://www.iitk.ac.in/infocell/iitk/MOU_FGIT.pdf |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2016-03-26 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170209175519/http://www.iitk.ac.in/infocell/iitk/MOU_FGIT.pdf |archivedate=9 February 2017 |df=dmy-all }}{{cite web|url=http://www.iitk.ac.in/infocell/iitk/newhtml/archivecnews.htm|publisher=iitk.ac.in|title=IITK – Indian Institute of Technology Kanpur|accessdate=2016-11-11|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170209175546/http://www.iitk.ac.in/infocell/iitk/newhtml/archivecnews.htm|archivedate=9 February 2017|df=dmy-all}} * Fundamentally, the [[Aerospace]] program is by [[FGIET|IET Raebareli]] from [[UPTU|APJ Abdul Kalam Technical University]]. * Currently, the program is running in complete collaboration with [[Indira Gandhi Rashtriya Uran Akademi]]. * [[MNNIT|MNNIT Allahabad]] and [[Indian Institute of Information Technology, Allahabad]] are providing academic assistance. * In future, [[Indian Institute of Science|Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore]] is said to be in full-fledged resource (academic and managerial) collaboration with [[FGIET|FGIET/ IET Raebareli]].{{cite web|url=http://jnn9india.blogspot.in/2015/06/rocketing-institutes-of-india.html|publisher=jnn9india.blogspot.in|title=jnn9: Rocketing Institutes of India|accessdate=2016-11-11}} Admission process depends on several factors including aptitude, intellect, personality and learning of the student. The selected students are a group who have qualified at-least one of the required admission tests like JEE-Mains/Advanced, WBJEE, SEE-AKTU and even SATs. The students have been provided residential services in-campus at Ratapur, Raebareli. The educational program will require for transition in between college departments/campuses on an annual even-semester basis. ==Campus== * The institute started functioning from a leased land from [[Feroze Gandhi Institute of Engineering and Technology]] at [[Rae Bareli]] as academic center and [[Indian Telephone Industries Limited|ITI Township]] as Residential center for almost 9 years. On 15 October 2016, the institute was moved to its 125-acre newly constructed permanent campus at [[Jais]], [[Uttar Pradesh]]. The infrastructure is not completely finished, but is expected to complete within 5 years.{{cite web|url=http://www.rgipt.ac.in/main_campus_project.htm|publisher=rgipt.ac.in|title=:: Welcome to Rajiv Gandhi Institute of Petroleum Technology ::|accessdate=2016-11-11}} * The new campus is a state-of-the-art campus with air conditioned classrooms having projectors, high definition televisions, computers for the faculty, video conferencing equipment. LAN connectivity has been provided in each room including hostel, classrooms along with permanent WI-FI setup has been provided.{{cite web|url=http://meity.gov.in/content/national-knowledge-network|publisher=meity.gov.in|title=National Knowledge Network | Government of India, Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology|accessdate=2016-11-11}}{{cite web|url=http://nkn.gov.in/connected-institutions|publisher=nkn.gov.in|title=nkn.gov.in/connected-institutions|accessdate=2016-11-11}} Image:Main_campus_building_of_RGIPT.jpg|''Campus Building'' Image:New_campus_RGIPT.jpg|''Inside campus of RGIPT'' Image:Chemistry_department.jpg|''Department building'' Image:Campus_building_rgipt.jpg|''Tennis court outside hostel'' Image:Chemical_and_petroleum_engineering_department_buildings.jpg|''Academic Blocks'' Image:Right_wing_of_central_library_at_RGIPT.jpg|''Part of Central Library'' Image:Close_up_of_Main_Hostel_RGIPT.jpg|''East side of the Hostel'' Image:Auditorium_rgipt.jpg|''Main Auditorium'' Image:Inside_classroom.jpg|''Inside Classroom'' Image:Staff_and_faculty_apartments.jpg|''Staff apartments'' Image:Local trainkaltarng.JPG|''Local Train Performance'' ==Kaltarang== '''Kaltarang''' is the annual cultural and sports fest of '''Rajiv Gandhi Institute of Petroleum Technology''', '''Amethi'''. It is a themed fest, generally held in the month of February every year, since the very first time in 2011. It is a three-day fest having events like rock band performance, fashion show, rock band competition, stand-up comedy, cyber gaming, themed events, various sports events. It attracts a lot of young crowd from across the state to take part in the events of the fest. In the past, rock bands, celebrities, poets such as Local Train, Astitva, surya kumar pandey have been a part of Kaltarang. It is one of the biggest cultural fest held in the Lucknow-Allahabad region. [[File:Faskaltarna.JPG|centre|thumb|573x573px]] ==Placements== During the campus inauguration speech of [[Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Gas|Minister of Petroleum and Natural Gas]] [[Dharmendra Pradhan|Shri Dharmendra Pradhan]] said: “The present central government has come up with many schemes for improving the standard of education in the country and it was our priority to start the RGIPT at the earliest. I assure that the government and private petroleum companies will come here for placements and the youths of Amethi will get accolades in the near future.”{{cite web|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/indiahome/indianews/article-3862814/No-time-Amethi-Rahul-Gandhi-busy-inaugurate-educational-Institute-named-father.html|publisher=dailymail.co.uk|title=No time for Amethi? Rahul Gandhi ‘too busy’ to inaugurate an educational Institute named after his father | Daily Mail Online|accessdate=2016-11-11}} The institute witnessed participation of multitude of companies across varied domains. Students of B.Tech., M.Tech. and MBA outgoing 2016 batch successfully got opportunities across diversified profiles and various functions in the organizational setup. Some of the prominent brands that came for final placements in the past and present were:{{cite web|url=http://www.rgipt.ac.in/b.tech_placements.htm|publisher=rgipt.ac.in|title=:: Welcome to Rajiv Gandhi Institute of Petroleum Technology ::|accessdate=2016-11-11}}http://www.rgipt.ac.in/pdf/placement_bro_2015_16.pdf [[File:Inauguration of rgipt.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Union ministers inauguration ceremony of RGIPT]] [[File:Inauguration of rgipt 2.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Union ministers lighting up the "Lamp of Knowledge"]] * [[Oil and Natural Gas Corporation]] * [[Oil India]] * [[Bharat Petroleum]] * [[Indian Oil Corporation]] * [[Hindustan Petroleum]] * [[Oil India Limited]] * [[NITI Aayog]]http://www.newindianexpress.com/nation/2018/apr/30/flouting-its-own-policy-niti-aayog-hired-28-plain-graduates-1808096.html * [[Oil and Natural Gas Corporation]] * [[Reliance Industries Limited]] * [[Bharat Oman Refinery Limited]] * [[Guru Gobind Singh Refinery|HMEL]] * [[American International Group]] * [[Engineers India|Engineers India Limited]] * [[UOP LLC]] * [[Cairn India]] * [[Essar Oil]] * [[Royal Dutch Shell|Shell Business Operations]] * [[Adani Group|ADANI GAS Ltd.]] * [[Petronet LNG]] * [[Haldia Petrochemicals]] * [[Larsen & Toubro Infotech]] * [[Tech Mahindra]] * [[Global Data]] * [[Globus Spirits]] * Avanti Learning Center Many students from the institute go further with higher education in the international universities. The institute recommends the meritorious students to these universities and also helps them in representing India at international conferences across the world.http://www.rgipt.ac.in/pdf/annual_report2015-16_041016.pdf{{cite web|url=http://www.rgipt.ac.in/index.htm|publisher=rgipt.ac.in|title=:: Welcome to Rajiv Gandhi Institute of Petroleum Technology | Ratapur Chowk | Rae Bareli ::|accessdate=2016-11-11}} ==Milestones== [[File:Foundation stone of rgipt assam.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Former Prime Minister [[Manmohan Singh]] laying foundation stone of RGIPT [[Assam|Assam Campus]] ]] [[File:Convocation at rgipt.jpg|right|thumb|300px|[[Dharmendra Pradhan|Petroleum Minister]] as chief guest at RGIPT's First Convocation]] * Jul 04, 2007: the [[Union Cabinet]] approved the setting up of the Rajiv Gandhi Institute of Petroleum Technology at Jais in Amethi District of UP.http://in.news.yahoo.com/070705/139/6hq7p.html{{dead link|date=April 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} * Nov 29, 2007: the [[Rajya Sabha]] passed the Rajiv Gandhi Institute of Petroleum Technology (RGIPT) Bill 2007.{{cite web|url=http://www.india4u.com/india4unews/Rajya-Sabha-Passes-Rajiv-Gandhi-Institute-of-Petroleum-Technology-Bill-2007-4295_1.htm|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080501190310/http://www.india4u.com/india4unews/Rajya-Sabha-Passes-Rajiv-Gandhi-Institute-of-Petroleum-Technology-Bill-2007-4295_1.htm|dead-url=yes|archive-date=2008-05-01|title=Rajya Sabha Passes Rajiv Gandhi Institute of Petroleum Technology Bill 2007 India4u News Online |accessdate=2016-11-11}} * Dec 3, 2007: the [[Lok Sabha]] passed the Rajiv Gandhi Institute of Petroleum Technology (RGIPT) Bill 2007.[http://www.dailyindia.com/show/196623.php/Lok-Sabha-passes-Rajiv-Gandhi-institute-of-petroleum-technology-bill Lok Sabha passes Rajiv Gandhi institute of petroleum technology bill] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20071209071404/http://www.dailyindia.com/show/196623.php/Lok-Sabha-passes-Rajiv-Gandhi-institute-of-petroleum-technology-bill |date=9 December 2007 }} * Feb 20, 2008: Congress President and UPA Chairperson [[Sonia Gandhi]] lays foundation stone of Rajiv Gandhi Institute of Petroleum Technology at [[Jais]].http://www.oneindia.com/2008/02/20/sonia-lays-foundation-stone-of-petroleum-institute-in-rae-bareli-1203512826.htm{{Dead link|date=July 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} * 2008–2009: start of academic session.{{cite web|url=http://pib.nic.in/release/release.asp?relid=33562|publisher=pib.nic.in|title= PIB Press Release |accessdate=2016-11-11}} * 2011: Former [[Prime Minister of India]] [[Manmohan Singh]] laid the foundations of the Rajiv Gandhi Institute of Petroleum Technology (Assam centre).{{cite web|url=http://www.orissalinks.com/archives/6076|publisher=orissalinks.com|title=Odisha HRD » PM inaugurates RGIPT second campus in Sibsagar Assam; Odisha must use the same logic and push for an ISMU campus in Odisha (PM also inugurated second campus of NID in Jorhat)|accessdate=2016-11-11}} * 2012: First B.Tech batch passes out.http://www.rgipt.ac.in/pdf/octane_contours_2012.pdf * 2013: [[Bangalore]] centre gets approved. * 2014: [[Veerappa Moily]], former [[Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Gas|Minister of Petroleum and Natural Gas]] inaugurates Rajiv Gandhi Institute of Petroleum Technology at Kambalipura Village, Hoskote Taluk, Bangalore District. * 2015: First Convocation was conducted with [[Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Gas|Minister of Petroleum and Natural Gas]] [[Dharmendra Pradhan]] and other high level dignitaries from [[Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Gas]] as Chief Guests. *2016: Institute is moved to the permanent campus at [[Jais]].{{cite web|url=http://zeenews.india.com/news/india/advice-to-rahul-gandhi-make-your-jijaji-robert-vadra-wear-kurta-pajama-first_1649844.html|publisher=zeenews.india.com|title=Advice to Rahul Gandhi: 'Make your jijaji Robert Vadra wear kurta pajama first' | Zee News|accessdate=2016-11-11}} * Oct 22, 2016: Union ministers, [[Ministry of Textiles|Minister of Textiles]] [[Smriti Irani|Shrimati Smriti Irani]], [[Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Gas|Minister of Petroleum and Natural Gas]] [[Dharmendra Pradhan|Shri Dharmendra Pradhan]] and [[Ministry of Human Resource Development|Minister of Human Resource Development]] [[Prakash Javadekar|Shri Prakash Javadekar]], inaugurated the permanent campus at [[Jais]].{{cite web|url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/india-news/rahul-afraid-of-facing-people-of-amethi-bjp-leaders-at-rgipt-inauguration/story-d4fy9ZqpApyj3po9hFVqXO.html|publisher=hindustantimes.com|title=Rahul afraid of facing people of Amethi: BJP leaders at RGIPT inauguration | india-news | Hindustan Times|accessdate=2016-11-11}} [[File:Students of rgipt.jpg|centre|thumb|500px|Union ministers with students and Faculty of RGIPT]] * May 2017: The institute increases the student intake for B.Tech program to 120 seats from 75 seats.http://rgipt.ac.in/btech_admission.htm * May 13, 2017: [[Chief Minister]] of [[Assam]] [[Sarbananda Sonowal]] and [[Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Gas|Minister of Petroleum and Natural Gas]] [[Dharmendra Pradhan|Shri Dharmendra Pradhan]] jointly launched the full swing construction work of second campus at [[Sivasagar district|Sivasagar]], [[Assam]]. * Dec 2017: [[Sivasagar|Sivasagar campus]] starts academic sessions for diploma in petroleum and chemical streams.http://www.rgipt.ac.in/pdf/Annual-Report_100118.pdfhttp://www.newindianexpress.com/cities/bengaluru/2017/jun/14/soon-karnataka-to-get-petroleum-research-institute-1616468.html * Sept 2018: [[Bangaluru|Bangalore Campus]] starts academic sessions for 3 M.Tech. courses in the fields of Renewable Energy, Power and Energy Systems Engineering and Energy Science and Technology. ==Budget== [[File:Rgipt director with ministers.jpg|thumb|350px|right|Union ministers inaugurating RGIPT's Campus]] ===Jais Campus=== * The total estimated capital cost : Rs. 861 crores (Rs. 416 crores (Central Exchequer) + Rs. 250 crores ([[Government of India|GOI]]) + Rs. 150 crores ([[Oil Industry Development Board]]) + Rs. 45 crores (Institute itself)){{cite web|url=http://www.projectsmonitor.com/detailnews.asp?newsid=12527 |title=Rajiv Gandhi Institute to cost Rs 861 crore |publisher=Projectsmonitor.com |date=2006-11-13 |accessdate=2012-12-06 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110928124204/http://www.projectsmonitor.com/detailnews.asp?newsid=12527 |archivedate=28 September 2011 |df= }} * The institute's permanent campus infrastructure was provided with Rs. 129 crores during Congress led UPA government and additional Rs. 302 crores were provided by the current NDA government for completion of campus.{{cite web|url=http://indianexpress.com/article/india/india-news-india/it-is-upas-historical-effort-rahul-on-rajiv-gandhi-petroleum-institute-inauguration-3096034/|publisher=indianexpress.com|title=It is UPA’s historical effort: Rahul on Rajiv Gandhi petroleum institute inauguration | The Indian Express|accessdate=2016-11-11}} * During fiscal 2016–17, [[Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Gas]] has allocated additional Rs. 47 crores while the institute remains independent to generate more funds for operational purposes through college fees and other funds/awards.{{Cite web |url=http://petroleum.nic.in/docs/aco/budget2016.pdf |title=Archived copy |access-date=21 October 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161021132348/http://petroleum.nic.in/docs/aco/budget2016.pdf |archive-date=21 October 2016 |dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all }}{{cite web|url=http://www.projectsmonitor.com/detailnews.asp?newsid%3D12527 |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2012-12-06 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110928124204/http://www.projectsmonitor.com/detailnews.asp?newsid=12527 |archivedate=28 September 2011 |df= }}{{cite web|url=http://www.business-standard.com/article/pti-stories/cong-cause-of-all-problems-country-facing-today-pradhan-116102200634_1.html|publisher=business-standard.com|title=Cong cause of 'all problems' country facing today: Pradhan | Business Standard News|accessdate=2016-11-11}} ===Sivasagar Campus=== * The [[Project plan|Detailed Project Report]] has stated the cost for setting up and running Sivasagar campus will be {{INRConvert|8.801|b}} in which {{INRConvert|3.96|b}} will be for spent for land acquisition and construction of facilities and {{INRConvert|4.83|b}} for running the institute.http://www.rgipt.ac.in/pdf/Annual-Report_100118.pdf ===Bangalore Campus=== * The [[Project plan|Detailed Project Report]] has stated the cost for setting up and running Bangalore campus will be {{INRConvert|18|b}} in which {{INRConvert|8|b}} will be for spent for land acquisition and construction of facilities and {{INRConvert|10|b}} for research related activities. It one of the most expensive research institutes in India.http://www.rgipt.ac.in/pdf/Annual-Report_100118.pdf ==See also== * [[Institute of National Importance]] * [[List of autonomous higher education institutes in India]] * [[Joint Entrance Examination]] * [[Education in India]] ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Amethi district}} {{Universities in Uttar Pradesh}} {{Higher education in India}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Rajiv Gandhi Institute Of Petroleum Technology}} [[Category:Universities and colleges in Amethi district]] [[Category:Engineering colleges in Uttar Pradesh]] [[Category:Amethi district]] [[Category:Petroleum engineering schools]] [[Category:Energy in Uttar Pradesh]] [[Category:Memorials to Rajiv Gandhi]] [[Category:Institutions of Petroleum in India]]

revision.text:
{{Use dmy dates|date=September 2017}} {{EngvarB|date=April 2015}} '''Richard Yemm''' is the British inventor of the [[Pelamis Wave Energy Converter]] and was director of the former [[Pelamis Wave Power]], a company he founded in [[Edinburgh]] in 1998.<ref name="ScotGov"/><ref name="BBC2012"/> In 2014 he co-founded a new company, Quoceant, who are engineering consultants specializing in marine energy and technology innovation.
==Biography== Yemm studied Mechanical Engineering at the [[University of Edinburgh]] from 1985 to 1989, gaining a first class honours degree.<ref name="ScotOil"/> As an undergraduate, he was also awarded a Half Blue for sailing in 1986–87 by the [[Edinburgh University Sports Union]], denoting performance to a very high standard.<ref name="EUSU"/> He completed his PhD in 1994<ref name="ScotOil"/> under Professor [[Stephen Salter]], former [[Saltire Prize]] medallist<ref name="ScotGov"/> and inventor of the [[Salter's duck|Edinburgh duck wave energy device]].
He went on to pursue a career as a self-employed design and development engineer on renewable energy projects,<ref name="SIE"/> gaining experience in the wind energy industry.<ref name="EEI"/> He invented the [[Pelamis Wave Energy Converter]] for generating electricity from marine waves, and established Ocean Power Delivery Ltd in 1998 to develop the product.<ref name="SIE"/> The company is now called Pelamis Wave Power Ltd. Yemm was CEO until August 2007, raising substantial investment and gaining commercial orders from 2005 onwards.<ref name="EEI"/> He then became CTO of the company.
Yemm was Chairman of the Board of Scottish Renewables trade association for over five years,<ref name="EEI"/> and is active in promoting renewable and wave energy.
==Recognition== In March 2012 Yemm was presented with the [[Saltire Prize]] medal by Scottish First Minister [[Alex Salmond]]. The chief executive of [[Scottish Renewables]], Niall Stuart, said, "Richard Yemm will undoubtedly be looked upon as one of the most influential people to the development of Scotland's marine industry; from the drawing board to grid connected devices and making important steps to commercial scale projects."<ref name="BBC2012"/>
==References== {{reflist|refs= <ref name="BBC2012">{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-scotland-17526389|publisher=BBC News|title=Saltire Prize medal for inventor of Pelamis wave 'sea snake'|date=28 March 2012|accessdate=2012-03-29}}</ref> <ref name="ScotGov">{{cite web|url=http://www.scotland.gov.uk/News/Releases/2012/03/SaltirePrizeMedalYemm280032012|title=Pelamis founder honoured for key role in marine energy |date=28 March 2012|publisher=The Scottish Government|accessdate=2012-03-29}}</ref> <ref name="ScotOil">{{cite web|url=http://www.scottishoilclub.org.uk/071115.htm|title=Richard Yemm, Founder and Chief Technical Officer, Ocean Power Delivery, Limited|date=23 March 2012|publisher=The Scottish Oil Club|accessdate=2012-03-29}}</ref> <ref name="EUSU">{{cite web|url=http://alumni.eusu.ed.ac.uk/index.php?s=content&p=Blues|publisher=Edinburgh University Sports Union Alumni Association|title=Blues & Half Blues|accessdate=2012-03-29}}</ref> <ref name="SIE">{{cite web|url=http://www.sie.ed.ac.uk/resources/Richard%20Yemm.htm|title=Richard Yemm, Ocean Power Delivery|date=10 December 2002|work=Scottish Institute for Enterprise|accessdate=2012-03-29}}</ref> <ref name="EEI">{{cite web|url=http://www.europeanentrepreneursatstanford.com/speaker_bios/bios_Spr09.php|title=European Entrepreneurship and Innovation Thought Leaders - ME421 - Stanford University|date=May 2009|accessdate=2012-03-29}}</ref> }}
==External links== *[http://www.pelamiswave.com Pelamis Wave Power Ltd] website *[http://www.quoceant.com Quoceant Ltd] website
{{Authority control}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Yemm, Richard}} [[Category:Scottish inventors]] [[Category:Alumni of the University of Edinburgh]] [[Category:Scottish mechanical engineers]] [[Category:Scottish company founders]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People associated with renewable energy]]

revision.text:
'''Selenopyrylium''' is an [[aromatic compound|aromatic]] [[heterocyclic compound]] consisting of a six member ring with five carbon atoms, and a positively charged [[selenium]] atom.<ref name=doddi>{{cite journal|last1=Doddi|first1=Giancarlo|last2=Ercolani|first2=Gianfranco|title=Thiopyrylium, Selenopyrylium, and Telluropyrylium Salts|journal=Advances in Heterocyclic Chemistry|date=1994|volume=60|pages=65–195|doi=10.1016/S0065-2725(08)60182-8|series=Advances in Heterocyclic Chemistry|isbn=9780120207602}}</ref><ref name="sugimoto">{{cite journal|last1=Sugimoto|first1=Toyonari|title=Reactions of Pyrylium, Thiopyrylium and Selenopyrylium Salts and Their Application to Synthetic Utility|journal=Journal of Synthetic Organic Chemistry, Japan|date=1981|volume=39|issue=1|pages=1–13|doi=10.5059/yukigoseikyokaishi.39.1}}{{openaccess}}</ref>
==Naming and numbering== Formerly it was named selenapyrylium. However this is misleading, as "selena" indicates that selenium substitutes for a carbon atom, but actually selenium is substituted for the oxygen atom in [[pyrylium]].<ref name=doddi/> In the Hantzsch-Widman system it is called seleninium. This is the name used by [[Chemical Abstracts]]. Replacement nomenclature would call this selenoniabenzene.<ref name=doddi/>
Numbering in selenopyrylium starts with 1 on the selenium atom and counts up to 6 counter-clockwise on the carbon atoms. The positions adjacent to the chalcogen, numbered 2 and 6 can also be called α, the next two positions 3 and 5 can be termed "β" and the opposite carbon at position 4 can be called "γ".<ref name=doddi/>
==Occurrence== Because selenopyrylium is a positively charged cation, it takes the solid form as a salt with non-nucleophillic anions like [[perchlorate]], [[tetrafluoroborate]], [[fluorosulfate]], or [[hexafluorophosphate]].<ref name=doddi/>
==Formation== Selenopyrylium and derivatives can be made from 1,5-diketones ([[glutaraldehyde]]), [[hydrogen selenide]] along with [[HCl]] as a catalyst in acetic acid solvent. A side product is 2,6-bis-(hydroseleno)selenacyclohexane.<ref name=doddi/>
When 5-chloro-2,4-pentadienenitrile derivatives react with soidum hydroselenide, or sodium selenite, and is then treated with perchloric acid, a 2-amino-selenopyrilium perchlorate salt results.<ref name=doddi/>
==Properties== The positive charge is not confined to the selenium atom, but distributes on the ring in several resonance structures, so that the α and γ positions have some positive charge. A nucleophillic attack targets these carbon atoms.<ref name=doddi/>
Selenopyrylium has two prominent absorption bands in the [[ultraviolet spectrum]], band I is at 3000 Å, and band II is at 2670 Å. Band I, also known as <sup>1</sup>''L''<sub>b</sub> is from the <sup>1</sup>''B''<sub>1</sub>←<sup>1</sup>''A''<sub>1</sub> transition. The wavelength is longer and the band is much stronger than that of [[benzene]]. This is a bathochromic shift. The wavelength is longer than in thiopyrylium and pyrylium, but the intensity is weaker, due to selenium being less electronegative. Band II, also called <sup>1</sup>''L''<sub>a</sub>, is stronger and longer than that of benzene, thiopyrylium and pyrylium. Band II is polarized in the direction of Se-γ axis.<ref name=doddi/>
The nuclear magnetic resonance spectrum shows a 10.98 ppm shift for H2 and 6, 8.77 for H3 and H5 and 9.03 for H4 (BF<sub>4</sub><sup>−</sup> salt dissolved in CD<sub>3</sub>CN).<ref name=doddi/> Compared to other pyryliums H2,6 is more than that of oxygen or sulfur, H3,5 is between that of oxygen and sulfur, and H4 is very similar to thiopyrylium, but is slightly lower. NMR for <sup>13</sup>C has the same trends as for the attached hydrogens.<ref name=doddi/>
Solvents include [[trifluoroacetic acid]], [[methanol]], [[dichloromethane]], [[chloroform]] and [[acetonitrile]].<ref name=doddi/>
==Derivatives== Many derivatives of selenopyrylium are known with side chains attached to carbons 2,3 or 6. Examples include 4-(''p''-dimethylaminophenyl)selenopyridinium, 2,6-diphenylselenopyridinium, 4-methyl-2,6-diphenylselenopyrylium, 2,4,6-triphenylselenopyrylium, 2,6-diphenyl-4-(''p''-dimethylaminophenyl)selenopyrylium. 2,6-di-''tert''-butylselenopyrylium.<ref name=doddi/>
==Related== When the ring is fused with other aromatic rings larger aromatic structures such as selenochromenylium, selenoflavylium, and selenoxanthylium result.<ref name=doddi/>
==References== {{Reflist}}
[[Category:Heterocyclic compounds (1 ring)]] [[Category:Organoselenium compounds]] [[Category:Aromatic compounds]] [[Category:Cations]] [[Category:Six-membered rings]]

In [[industrial chemistry]], a '''stabilizer''' is a chemical that is used to prevent degradation.<ref>{{cite encyclopedia|title=Plastics, Additives|encyclopedia=Ullmann's Encyclopedia Of Industrial Chemistry|author1=Rainer Wolf|author2=Bansi Lal Kaul|year=2000|doi=10.1002/14356007.a20_459}}</ref> Heat and light stabilizers are added to plastics and elastomers because they ensure safe processing and protect products against aging and weathering. The trend is towards fluid systems, [[wikt:pellet|pellet]]s, and increased use of masterbatches. There are monofunctional, bifunctional, and polyfunctional stabilizers. In economic terms the most important product groups on the market for stabilizers are compounds based on calcium (calcium-zinc and organo-calcium), lead, and tin stabilizers as well as liquid and light stabilizers (HALS, benzophenone, benzotriazole). Cadmium-based stabilizers largely vanished in the last years due to health and environmental concerns.<ref>Ceresana, Market Study Stabilizers, March 2014, http://www.ceresana.com/en/market-studies/additives/stabilizers/</ref>
<gallery caption="Representative Stabilizers" widths="180px" heights="120px" > File:BigPhosphite31570-04-4.png|[[Tris(2,4-di-tert-butylphenyl)phosphite]] is a widely used stabilizer in polymers. File:HALSgeneric.png|Partial structure of typical [[hindered amine light stabilizers]], widely used to protect automotive paints from degradation by UV-light. File:Salpn.png|Salpn is a typical [[metal deactivator]] used as a fuel additive to suppress oxidation processes that lead to gums and solids. Metal deactivators like salpn form stable complexes with the metals, suppressing their catalytic activity.<ref>{{Ullmann|author = Dabelstein, W.|author2 = Reglitzky A.|author3 = Schutze A.|author4 = Reders, K.|title = Automotive Fuels}}</ref> </gallery> ==Polymers== {{main|Stabilizer for polymers}} Some kinds of stabilizers are: * [[antioxidant]]s these prevent [[autoxidation]] of materials and come in 3 primary forms. ** Oxygen scavengers (primarily [[phosphite ester]]s such as [[tris(2,4-di-tert-butylphenyl)phosphite]]) are commonly used during the initial processing of the plastic. ** Persistent [[Radical (chemistry)|radical]] scavengers prevent or slow the [[photo-oxidation of polymers]]. Traditionally these are alkylataed phenols such as [[butylated hydroxytoluene]] but now also include [[hindered amine light stabilizers]] (HALS) ** [[Antiozonant]]s prevents or retards the degradation of polymers caused by [[ozone]] ([[ozone cracking]]) * [[sequestrant]]s, forming [[chelation|chelate complexes]] and inactivating traces of metal ions that would otherwise act as catalysts * [[UV stabilizers in plastics|ultraviolet stabilizers]] are used to protect polymers from effects of [[ultraviolet]] radiation and come to 2 main types. ** UV absorbers which essentially act the same way as [[sunscreen]]s ** Quenchers, which dissipate the radiation energy as heat instead of letting it break chemical bonds; often organic [[nickel]] salts, e.g. nickel [[phenolate]]s
==Paints== * [[emulsifier]]s and [[surfactant]]s, for stabilization of [[emulsion]]s
==Food== In foods, stabilizers prevent spoilage. Classes of food stabilizers include "[[emulsifier]]s, [[thickener]]s and gelling agents, foam stabilizers, humectants, [[anticaking agent]]s, and coating agents."<ref name=Ullmann>Erich Lück, Gert-Wolfhard von Rymon Lipinski "Foods, 3. Food Additives" in ''Ullmann's Encyclopedia of Industrial Chemistry'', 2002, Wiley-VCH, Weinheim. {{DOI| 10.1002/14356007.a11_561}}</ref>
==See also== * [[Corrosion inhibitor]] * [[Stabilizers for polymers]]
==References== {{Reflist}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Stabilizer (Chemistry)}} [[Category:Chemical kinetics]] [[Category:Chemical compounds]] [[Category:Material protection]]
{{Chem-stub}}

revision.text:
{{Orphan|date=April 2015}}
The flow in many fluids varies with density and depends upon the gravity. Due to which the fluid with lower density is always above the fluid with higher density. '''Stratified flows''' are very common such as the Earth's ocean and its atmosphere.<ref> http://www-vortex.mcs.st-and.ac.uk/strat.html</ref>
== Stratified fluid == A [[stratified fluid]] may be defined as the fluid with density variations in the vertical direction. For example, air and water; both are fluids and if we consider them together then they can be seen as a stratified fluid system. Density variations in the atmosphere profoundly affect the motion of water and air. Wave phenomena in air flow over the mountains and occurrence of smog are the examples of stratification effect in the atmosphere. When a fluid system having a condition in which fluid density decreases with height, is disturbed, then the gravity and friction restore the undisturbed conditions. If however the fluid tends to be stable if density decreases with height.<ref>{{cite journal|last1=Long|first1=Robert R.|title=Fluid film mechanics|journal=Film notes for stratified flows|volume=21618|accessdate=21 November 2014}}</ref>
== Upstream motions in stratified flow == It is known that the sub critical flow of a stratified fluid past a barrier produce motions upstream of the barrier. Sub critical flow may be defined as a flow for which the [[Froude number]] based on channel height is less than 1/π, so that one or more stationary [[lee waves]] would be present. Some of the upstream motions do not decompose with the distance upstream. These ‘[[columnar]]’ modes have zero frequency and a [[sinusoidal]] structure in the direction of the density gradient; they effectively lead to a continuous change in upstream conditions. If the barrier is two-dimensional (i.e. of infinite extent in the direction perpendicular to the upstream flow and the direction of density gradient), [[inviscid]] theories show that the length of the upstream region affected by the columnar modes increases without bound as t->infinity. Non-zero viscosity (and/or diffusivity) will, however, limit the region affected, since the wave amplitudes will then slowly decay.<ref>{{cite journal|last1=Castro|first1=I.P.|last2=Snyder|first2=W.H.|title=J. Fluid Mech.|journal=Upstream motions in stratified flow|date=20 May 1986|volume=187|issue=5 August 1987)|page=487}}</ref>
== Efficient mixing in stratified flows == Turbulent mixing in stratified flows is described by mixing efficiency. This mixing efficiency compares the energy used in irreversible mixing, enlarging the minimum [[gravitational potential energy]] that can be kept in the density field, to the entire change in [[mechanical energy]] during the mixing process. It can be defined either as an integral quantity, calculated between inert initial and final conditions or as a fraction of the energy flux to mixing and the power into the system. These two definitions can give different values if the system is not in steady state. Mixing efficiency is especially important in oceanography as mixing is required to keep the overall stratification in a steady-state ocean. The entire amount of mixing in the oceans is equal to the product of the power input to the ocean and the mean mixing efficiency.<ref>{{cite journal|last1=Davies Wykes|first1=Megan S.|last2=Dalziel|first2=Stuart B.|title=J. Fluid Mech.|journal=Efficient mixing in stratified flows: experimental study of a Rayleigh-Taylor unstable interface within an otherwise stable stratification|volume=756|page=1027|doi=10.1017/jfm.2014.308}}</ref>
== Stability criteria for stratified flow == Wallis and Dobson (1973) estimate their criterion with transition observations that they call “Slugging” and note that empirically the stability limit is described by
<math> j^* = 0.5 \alpha^{3/2} </math>
Here <math> \alpha= {\left ( \frac{h_{G}}{H} \right )} </math> and <math> j^*= \left [ \frac{U_{G}\alpha{\sqrt{\rho_{G}}}}{\sqrt{gH(\rho_{L}-\rho_{G})}} \right ] \quad </math> where H is channel height and U, h and ρ denote the mean velocity, holdup and density respectively. The subscripts G and L stand for gas and liquid and g denotes Gravity. Taitel and Dukler (1976) [TD] expanded the (Kelvin and helmholtz) KH analysis first to the case of a finite wave on a flat liquid sheet in horizontal channel flow and then to finite waves on stratified liquid in an Inclined pipe. In order to apply this criterion they need to provide the equilibrium liquid level hL (or liquid holdup). They calculate <math> h_{L} </math>through momentum balances in the gas and liquid phases (two fluid models) in which shear stresses are examine and assessed using conventional friction factors definitions. In two fluid models, the pipe geometry is taken into consideration through wetted perimeters by the gas and liquid phases, including the gas-liquid interface. This states that the wall resistance of the liquid is similar to that for [[open-channel flow]] and that of the gas to close-duct flow. This geometry analysis is general and could be applied not only to round pipes, but to any other possible shape. In this method, each pair of superficial gas and liquid velocity relates to a distinctive value of <math> h_{L} </math> . According to [TD], a finite wave will grow in a horizontal rectangular channel of height H, when <math> j^* > {\left ( 1- \frac{h_{L}}{H} \right ) \alpha^{3/2}} </math> or <math> U_{G} > {\left (1- \frac{h_{L}}{H}\right)}{\left (\frac{(\rho_{L}-\rho_{G})g A_{G}}{\rho_{G}dA_{L}/dh_{L}}\right)^{1/2}} </math> for inclined pipe. D is the pipe diameter and A is the cross section area. Note that <math> {\left ( 1- \frac{h_{L}}{H} \right )} = \alpha </math>. If <math> {\left (\frac{h_{L}}{H} \right )}=0.5 </math> , <math> {\left ( 1- \frac{h_{L}}{H} \right )}=0.5 </math> , and this is compatible with the result of Wallis and Dobson(1973) The [TD] overall procedure result to a weak dependence on viscosity, through the calculation of <math> h_{L} </math>. [TD] also identify two kinds of [[stratified flow]]: stratified smooth (SS) and stratified wavy (SW). These waves, as they say, “are produced by the gas flow under conditions where the velocity of gas is enough to cause waves to form, but slower than that needed for the quick wave growth which leads transition to intermittent or annular flow.” [TD] suggest a standard to predict the transition from stratified smooth to stratified wavy flow, based on Jeffreys’ (1925, 1926) ideas.<ref>{{cite journal|last1=Mata|first1=C.|last2=Pereyra|first2=E.|last3=Trallero|first3=J. L.|last4=Joseph|first4=D. D.|title=Intevep|journal=Stability of stratified gas-liquid flows|date=March 2002|pages=5, 6, 7}}</ref>
== Effects of stratification on diffusion == Density stratification has significant effect on diffusion in fluids. For example, smoke which is coming from a chimney diffuses turbulently if the earth atmosphere is not stably stratified. When the lower air is in stable condition, as in morning or early evening, the smoke comes out and become flat into a long, thin layer. Strong stratification, or inversions as they are called sometimes, restrict contaminants to the lower regions of the earth atmosphere, and cause many of our current air-pollution problems.<ref>{{cite journal|last1=Long|first1=Robert R.|title=Fluid film mechanics|journal=Film notes for stratified flows|volume=21618|accessdate=21 November 2014}}</ref>
== References == {{Reflist}}
==External links== * [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9hmjcIfy8wE Stratified Flow]
[[Category:Density]] [[Category:Fluid mechanics]]

revision.text:
{{Infobox company |name = Wavebob |logo = File:High Res Logo.jpg| |type = Privately Held |foundation = 1999 |location = Ireland, USA |key_people = Andrew Parish -[[CEO]]
Göran Dandanell -Chairman
William Dick -Inventor
Dr. Jochem Weber -Research Manager
Dr. Ronan Costello -Hydraulics Team Leader |industry = [[Wave Energy]] |products = [WECs] Wave Energy Conversion Buoys |homepage = }} '''Wavebob''' was a wave energy converter which was in development between 1999 and 2013 when the company was closed owing to funding difficulties.{{cite news|last=Downing|first=Louise|title=Wavebob Shuts Down After Failing to Raise Funds, Find Partner|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/2013-04-03/wavebob-shuts-down-after-failing-to-raise-funds-find-partner.html|accessdate=5 November 2013|newspaper=Bloomberg|date=4 April 2013}} It commenced the first of a number of sea trials in [[Galway Bay]] in [[Ireland]] during which it was tested as a 1/4 scale device for short periods at the SEAI 1/4 Scale Wave Power Testing facility[http://www.sei.ie/Renewables/Ocean_Energy/Wave_Energy_Research_in_Ireland/ Description of Galway Bay Wave Test Facility from SEI Website] which is located in the inner bay inside the natural [[Aran Islands]] breakwater and where devices under test are exposed to c.1/3 of the expected energy of the 'Full Atlantic Ocean'.[http://www.maps.marine.ie/wave/default.aspx Ireland Wave Atlas Online GIS . SEI Quarter Scale Test Site Located At -9.269W 53.233N][http://www.maps.marine.ie/wave/default.aspx Ireland Wave Atlas Online GIS . SEI Full Scale Model Test Site To Be Constructed and Located At -9.989W 54.164N] Coming Onstream 2011 or 2012 ==Technology== Wavebob used the lift and fall of ocean waves to drive generators {{cite web|last1=Mouwen|first1=Franc|title=Presentation to Engineers Ireland 2008|url=https://www.engineersireland.ie/EngineersIreland/media/SiteMedia/groups/Divisions/new-energy/Wavebob-Development_of_a_Wave_Energy_Converter.pdf?ext=.pdf|website=Engineers Ireland|accessdate=13 March 2016}} The Wavebob consisted of two oscillating structures. These structures must be able to absorb in a variety of conditions and be robust to survive in the harsh marine environment. The structures are controlled by a damping system that can respond to predicted wave height, wave power and frequency. The tank structure (a semi-submerged body) uses captured sea water mass as the majority of its inertial mass. This significantly reduces the cost associated with structural materials. Wavebob developed its business through an Open Innovation Model and was partnered with leading energy companies such as Chevron and Vattenfall. It briefly established a joint venture company with Vattenfall called Tonn Energy[http://www.tonnenergy.ie Tonn Energy ] to develop commercial wave farms off the west coast of Ireland. ==Company milestones== 1999: Original patents filed 2007: CEO appointed; head office in Maynooth established 2013: Company Closed Down. ==See also== [[Wave farm]]
[[Maritime Research Institute Netherlands]]
[[Marine Institute Ireland]]
[[Pelamis Wave Energy Converter]]
[[OE buoy]] ==References== ==Further reading== * Falnes, Johannes (2002). Ocean Waves and Oscillating Systems. Cambridge University Press. {{ISBN|0-521-01749-1}}., 288 pp. * McCormick, Michael (2007). Ocean Wave Energy Conversion. Dover. {{ISBN|0-486-46245-5}}., 256 pp. [[Category:Wave energy converters]]
